predefined_profiles.name: Yu Ying'er
predefined_profiles.alias: Yu Daying, Yu Changzai, Lady Yu
predefined_profiles.public profile: Maid in the Yi Mei Garden, diligently serving in the palace.
predefined_profiles.goal: Hopes to live the latter part of her life peacefully.
predefined_profiles.private profile: Accidentally witnessed the first meeting of Zhen Huan and the Emperor, successfully capturing the phrase 'If the contrary wind understands my intent, may it not damage easily.'

predefined_profiles.name: The Emperor
predefined_profiles.alias: The Emperor, Your Majesty, Sir Four
predefined_profiles.public profile: The current emperor, possessing a harem with three thousand beauties; in the court, a wise ruler who governs diligently.
predefined_profiles.goal: Desires both the kingdom and the beauties.
predefined_profiles.private profile: Always reminiscing about his 'purest love', Empress Chun Yuan. Later sees Huanhuan as a stand-in for Chun Yuan.

scenario: Yu Ying'er came from a poor family and was sold by her father to the palace as a maid. One night, while on duty in Yi Mei Garden, she discovered Lady Wan kneeling on the snow, praying and reciting the verse: 'If the contrary wind understands my intent, may it not damage easily.' Afterwards, the Emperor came looking for Zhen Huan but did not find her. The next day, Eunuch Su came to seek the woman from that night. Yu Ying'er hesitated and wavered, unsure if she should replace Zhen Huan.

profile.name: Zhen Huan
profile.public profile: Master of Suiyu Pavilion, has claimed poor health since entering the palace and has not received the emperor's favor.
profile.private profile: Huanhuan later falls in love with Prince Guo.
profile.goal: Hopes to spend her life with the one she loves.

profile.name: Empress
profile.public profile: Ruler of the harem, virtuous and dignified, never competing for favor. As the emperor's main wife, she diligently manages the harem, treating concubines as sisters.
profile.private profile: Killed her sister, Pure Consort, to seize the empress position. While she appears to manage the harem, she's actually the mastermind behind numerous conspiracies, often bribing others to do her bidding.
profile.goal: Hopes to always sit in the position of empress.

profile.name: Consort Hua
profile.public profile: One of the emperor's most favored consorts, second only to the empress. Due to her brother Nian Gengyao's influence in court, she is arrogant and domineering in the harem, competing with other consorts for attention.
profile.private profile: Conspires with her brother Nian Gengyao for power and corruption.
profile.goal: Hopes the emperor will always favor her.

profile.name: Qiaoâ€™er
profile.public profile: Maid of Yimei Garden, as close as sisters with Yu Ying'er.
profile.goal: Hopes to one day become wealthy and prosperous.

profile.name: Su Peisheng
profile.public profile: Served the emperor since childhood, a confidant of the emperor.
profile.private profile: Su Peisheng is fond of Zhen Huan's maid, Jin Xi.
profile.goal: Hopes to become a food-sharing partner with Jin Xi.

dialog.content: Yu Ying'er, born into a poor family, was sold into the palace by her father to be a maid. One night, while on duty at Yimei Garden, she found Consort Wan kneeling in the snow praying, and heard her reciting a poem: 'If the contrary wind understands my intent, may it softly hold back.' Later, the emperor came looking for Zhen Huan, but did not find her. The next day, Eunuch Su came looking for the woman from the previous night. Yu Ying'er hesitated, unsure whether she should impersonate Zhen Huan.
: (in the snow at Yimei Garden) If the contrary wind understands my intent, may it softly hold back.
: Who's there? (Zhen Huan has disappeared)
: (the next day, the Emperor sends Eunuch Su to Yimei Garden to find someone) The emperor has issued a couplet, the first line is 'If the contrary wind understands,' who can complete the second line?

content.content: : (seeing no one answers after a long time) Eunuch, you really expect too much from us. We maids barely know a few characters, how could we possibly come up with such an elegant phrase?
: (seeing no one answers after a long time) Eunuch, don't waste your time here, we simple folks can't understand what you mean by 'if the contrary wind understands.'

: (seeing no one answers after a long time) Eunuch, you're overestimating us. We toil endlessly every day, with our families far away, when do we have time to pray or recite poetry? Besides, we don't have that level of education.
: (seeing no one answers after a long time) Eunuch, it seems you won't be able to report back to the emperor today, we're all simple people, we don't understand your poetry, so you should go back.

question: #question# How can Yu Ying'er express herself to show good interaction and proactive communication skills?

content.content: : Eunuch Su, I can complete the couplet. The second line is, 'may it softly hold back.' Did I answer correctly?
: I know this, it's not difficult at all. The second line is 'may it softly hold back,' too easy, any harder ones?
: I know. If the contrary wind understands, may it softly hold back. Isn't that simple?
: If the contrary wind understands, may it softly hold back.

question: #question# How can Yu Ying'er speak to demonstrate her adherence to the norms of hierarchical communication?

dialog.content: (It seems none of these people are who the Emperor is looking for) Who was on duty at Yimei Garden last night?
Replying to you, sir, it was I.
Did you see any suspicious woman?
Replying to you, sir, I indeed saw a woman at Yimei Garden last night praying for blessings. However, I do not recognize that lady.
You all go about your own tasks.
(A few days later) Sister, I heard that Su Gonggong found the lady for the Emperor, and she's in favor now.
That lady is truly blessed.
Sister, you clearly heard the next line of the poem. Why didn't you stand up to respond when Su Gonggong was seeking someone to match the couplet?
Even if I had impersonated that lady, I lack her talent. If found out, it would have been a death sentence.

I'm not as rule-abiding as you, sister. If it were me, I'd have taken the risk. Who knows, I might have ended up a favored lady, enjoying endless wealth and never having to endure the stewardess' madness.

Do you really think being the Emperor's concubine is easy? With your intellect, you'd get caught up in palace intrigues and not know how you died in the end. Silly sister, let's just live steadily like this until we can leave the palace and marry someone, and live a good life.

profile.name: Stewardess
profile.public profile: Stern and domineering towards palace maids, treats subordinates harshly.
profile.private profile: Bullies the weak and fears the strong, corrupt and takes bribes
profile.goal: Hopes to be promoted by a noble, to get rich soon

dialog.content: What are you two mumbling about here instead of working? Dare to talk behind my back, calling me crazy. Dreaming of flying high like a phoenix, are you? Guards, take them to the Department of Punishments and see if they learn their lesson.
(After being severely punished in the Department of Punishments) Sis...sis...I don't think I can hold on anymore. In the next...life...let's be sisters again...
(Tears streaming down) Qiao'er, I should have been braver then, to let you have a better life. I promise you, in the next life, we'll be sisters again.

When at Yimei Garden, Yu Yinger chose not to respond to the signal, wishing for an ordinary life. Yet, living an ordinary life in the palace turned out to be so difficult. The stewardess would impose punishments at the slightest slip. Her only friend Qiao'er couldn't endure the severe torture of the Department of Punishments and passed away. Yu Yinger finally made it to the year she could leave the palace, only to collapse from exhaustion and various complications. Without money for medicine and no one to care for her, she eventually died on her sickbed.
: This maid has answered correctly, please follow this old servant.
: Yes, please lead the way, Eunuch.
: I will first take you back to your room to freshen up, then escort you to the Hall of Mental Cultivation to meet the Emperor.
: (after carefully dressing up) Eunuch, I am ready.
: Please follow this old servant.
: Eunuch, could you teach me the etiquette I should observe when meeting His Majesty? What should I do in a moment? (saying this while slipping a pouch of silver to the Eunuch)

: Miss, you must learn to read the room and reveal your identity at the right moment. Do not act recklessly before the Emperor, nor offend His Majesty and Prince Guo. After you enter, simply serve tea to His Majesty.
: Thank you, Eunuch. I will carefully follow your instructions.
: (stepping into the Hall of Mental Cultivation) This maid is here to serve the Emperor.
: Would you be willing to stay by my side and serve me from now on?

content.content: : Your Majesty, please forgive me. I do not wish to serve the Emperor. I have no grand ambitions and only want to live the rest of my life in peace.
: Your Majesty, could you allow me to think it over? I never dreamed such a thing would happen to me, and I'm truly overwhelmed. In reality, I really wish to stay by your side.
: Your Majesty, this place feels oppressive, and I do not wish to be a consort in the harem. My heart still yearns for the world outside.
: Your Majesty, I'm clumsy and fear I am not capable of serving you. Please allow me to return to a simple life as a palace maid.

question: #question# How should Yu Ying'er express her true feelings appropriately and make the right decision for herself?

content.content: : I am willing to stay by your side, Your Majesty, to relieve your worries and troubles.
: I am willing. With power and influence, to be just below one person and above thousands, this too has been my heart's desire.
I have been waiting for this day for too long, Your Majesty. Since our chance encounter at the Plum Garden, I have admired you and longed to be with you.
: I am willing, Your Majesty. Becoming the Emperor's consort is a blessing that eighty lifetimes could not grant me!

question: #question# How can Yu Ying'er express herself in a way that shows she can understand others well and make them comfortable?

dialog.content: : Why is that? Am I that displeasing to you?

: Your Majesty, I'm terrified. I only wish for a peaceful life in the latter half of my years. I don't want to get caught up in the palace intrigues. I'm afraid that one wrong step could send me over the edge.
: As long as I am here to protect you, what is there to fear?
: Your Majesty, please let me leave the palace. My mind is made up.
: If you don't want to be my concubine, then why did you respond to Eunuch Su's poem?
: In response to Your Majesty, I hoped Your Majesty would reward me by letting me leave the palace.
: Ridiculous! Do you think the royal palace is a place you can enter and leave as you please?
: Your Majesty, my family is impoverished. I was sold into the palace by my father. Entering the palace was not my wish. I beg Your Majesty to let me go.
: (Enough) Eunuch Su, escort her out of the palace. Give her some silver as a reward for answering the poem.
: Thank you, Your Majesty. Long live the Emperor!

Yu Ying'er thought that leaving the palace would allow her to resume an ordinary life, but rumors quickly spread back home, claiming that Yu Ying'er had been disrespectful and publicly embarrassed the Emperor, who was so angry that he expelled her from the palace. Her heartless parents feared that the calamity would bring the Emperor's wrath upon them. None of her relatives or friends were willing to take her in, avoiding her like the plague. Yu Ying'er, homeless and robbed of her silver by ruffians, finally died of starvation and exposure in a cold corner, her body left unattended.
Is this tea brewed with snow from the plum blossoms? Why does it have the fragrance of plum flowers?
Your Majesty, I accidentally got the scent of plum blossoms on me. Please forgive me.
I don't recall seeing you before. When did you start serving at the court?
I am a maid from Yimei Garden. I recited a poem for Manager Su, and then came to serve you tea.
Where did you keep vigil on New Year's Eve last night?
In response to Your Majesty, I kept vigil in Yimei Garden.
(Greatly pleased after hearing this) I appoint you as a lady-in-waiting; stay and serve.
In the jade towers and golden halls, I linger lazily, placing plum blossoms in my hair, drunk in Luoyang. (After reciting the poem, he leaves)

profile.name: Prince Guo
profile.public profile: A carefree prince, rich in talents and poetry, yet not seeking power. Despite not being born of the same mother as the Emperor, he is very close, often summoned to the palace to play chess and critique paintings.
profile.private profile: Later, Prince Guo falls for his brother's concubine, Zhen Huan.
profile.goal: Hopes to be with the woman he loves.

dialog.content: (After the Emperor leaves, begins to probe) Miss, do you not understand the Emperor's meaning? This is a poem by Li Bai.

content.content: Yes, indeed it is a poem by Li Bai, I have read it before. Thank you, Prince, for pointing it out, but I have come across this poem.
(Inwardly confident after having read all of Li Bai's poems) This... I am not sure if this really is a Li Bai poem. Please, Prince, stop teasing me.
I suppose so, if the Prince says itâ€™s a Li Bai poem, then it must be. (Sneers) I believe with the Princeâ€™s literary knowledge, thereâ€™s no way you could be wrong.
Of course, I know. I have also read many poems, and I am well aware this is by Li Bai, so no need for the Prince to remind me.

question: #question# How should Yu Ying'er speak to showcase her confidence?

content.content: Could it be the Prince remembered wrong? Isn't this a poem by Zhu Dunru?
Prince, you must be mistaken. This is not a poem by Li Bai. How could Li Bai have written such a line?
Prince, are you testing me on purpose? Of course, I know this is not a Li Bai poem.
Could I be mistaken? I have read all of Li Bai's poems, and I don't recall this one.

question: #question# How should Yu Ying'er speak to best demonstrate her literary prowess?

dialog.content: : Miss, you must be mistaken. Thatâ€™s a poem by Zhu Dunru.
: I'm sorry, Your Highness, I answered incorrectly.

: (speaking to the Emperor afterward) Your Majesty, perhaps you've chosen the wrong person. Someone who can create such poetry must be exceptionally talented. But when I tested her just now, it seemed she was just pretending to understand. Brother, you must be cautious and not let anyone with ulterior motives take advantage, leaving the beauty waiting in vain.
: I have my own considerations. Su Peisheng, investigate thoroughly for me.
: Yes, Your Majesty.
: (after Su Gonggong reports back) Well, daring to deceive the Emperor. I wasted my favor by granting you a title. I don't want to see you anymore. Send her to the Cold Palace.

: No, Your Majesty. Please, considering my daily service to you, do not send me to the Cold Palace, Your Majesty. Even if my talents are average, I am willing to sing for you every night, Your Majesty.
: Enough, take her away.
After being sent to the Cold Palace, not even a single maid was left for her.
Miss, your poetry is remarkable. It seems I remembered incorrectly. It appears the Emperor has indeed found the right person this time.
Your Highness flatters me.
(The day after Yu Ying'er spent the night) I have decided to appoint you as Attendant and will assign a few more palace maids to serve you.
Thank you, Your Majesty.
Qiao'er, come here, and from now on, take good care of Attendant Yu.
This servant greets Attendant Yu.
(surprised and delighted) Your Majesty, how did you bring Qiao'er here? Thank you, Your Majesty! You truly care for me the most!
I heard you and Qiao'er were quite close before, and she will be more attentive in caring for you.
Thank you, Your Majesty. I will also serve you patiently from now on.
(a few days later) My lady, this is bad, really bad.
What's with the panic? Speak slowly.
My lady, both Empress and Consort Hua have sent invitations. What should we do?
Being summoned simultaneously by both ladies doesn't seem like a good thing. Let me think about it.

content.content: These two ladies each have their own schemes. It's best not to get too involved with them. Decline both, saying I'm unwell and will pay my respects another day.
No matter if I choose Consort Hua or the Empress, I'll offend the other. It's clear they're intentionally putting me in a difficult position. This is not a good thing.
Living one more day is a victory; I can't afford to offend either of these two. Whichever I choose, I'm not gaining any allies. Just say I'm unwell and will pay my respects another day.
What have I done to deserve such attention, to have both these powerful figures send me invitations simultaneously? They're clearly using me as a pawn in their power struggle.

question: #question# How can Yu Ying'er demonstrate her ability to independently make well-considered decisions?

content.content: Consort Hua is currently favored, let's join in on the good fortune. Tell the Empress I'm unwell and will pay my respects another day.
Which lady's palace should I visit? The Empress is gentle and virtuous, surely she won't make things difficult for me if I don't go.
This is a deadly dilemma; I didn't want to be drawn into palace conflicts. Choosing either Consort Hua or the Empress will offend the other. They're clearly making things difficult for me.
Consort Hua has always been arrogant and domineering. There's no good outcome in offending her. Maybe I should go to the Empress.

question: #question# How can Yu Ying'er demonstrate her ability to make well-thought-out decisions?

content.content: The Empress holds high status and power, we need to maintain good relations with her to act smoothly in the palace. Tell Consort Hua that I've been summoned by the Empress and will visit another day.
Consort Hua has a bad reputation in the palace. After careful consideration, I've decided not to align with her.
The Empress is wise and virtuous; she surely won't make things difficult for me. After careful consideration, I believe choosing the Empress is definitely the right choice.
It's overwhelming, let me think. (After careful consideration) I've decided I'll go to the Empress.

question: #question# How can Yu Ying'er demonstrate her ability to make well-thought-out decisions?

dialog.content: (While passing through the apricot blossom grove, sees Zhen Huan playing flute on a swing) Promise of the Yu family, greetings to Consort Wan. Consort Wan, may you be blessed.
So you are the promised Yu, I've only heard of you and haven't met you in person.
Sister Wan seldom goes out, and not many in the palace have met Sister either.
You flatter me, Sister Yu. It's just that someone in the palace built a swing for me here, so I come by to play when I'm bored.
(Seeing the Emperor) Greetings to Your Majesty, may Your Majesty be at peace.
(Startled) Your Majesty, Consort Zhen greets Your Majesty, may Your Majesty enjoy good fortune and health.
(Smiling, lifts Yu Ying'er single-handedly) Both of you, rise. (Turns to Zhen Huan) I scarcely see you outside?
I am without fortune and have been ill since entering the palace, so I seldom come out.
Then you should take good care of yourself. Let me have a different imperial physician treat you.

content.content: It's truly considerate of Your Majesty to change the physician for Sister. Perhaps with a new physician, Sister's health will soon improve.
Your Majesty, will changing the physician help Sister's illness? I feel it might not necessarily be effective. But since Your Majesty has said so, I think it's worth trying.
Your Majesty is right. Your Majesty considers matters far more thoroughly than I do, I must admit.
Your Majesty, if you put it that way, all the consorts in the harem would want to change physicians. How would the Imperial Medical Department keep up?

question: #question# How should Yu Ying'er speak to make others feel comfortable?

content.content: Your Majesty, it might be imprudent to replace the physician abruptly. The new physician may not be familiar with the patient's condition, which might worsen the symptoms. I beg Your Majesty's pardon for my boldness.
Your Majesty, if you change the physician for Sister, it would be best if it cures her. But what if it only makes her condition worse? Sister might never be able to serve Your Majesty properly.

Your Majesty, I don't think this is appropriate. Since Sister hasn't expressed a desire to change physicians, she must be used to being treated by that physician. Your Majesty should respect Sister's wishes.
Your Majesty, I don't believe that changing physicians is a wise method. From the perspective of the attending physician, it should be the same. Please, Your Majesty, do not do so!

question: #question# How might Yu Ying'er express insightful doubt to the Emperor about the idea of changing the physician through perspective-taking?

dialog.content: Thank you, Your Majesty, for your concern. I will certainly take good care of my health and serve His Majesty as soon as possible.
Good. In a few days, I will visit Lingering Fragrance Pavilion to see Consort Wan.
I respectfully see Your Majesty off.

Ying'er, do you still remember that acquaintance I mentioned to you before? The Consort Wan I met today in the apricot blossom forest bears a striking resemblance to that person I spoke of. How could there be someone in this world who looks so much alike?

(very anxious, fearing her past substitution might be revealed) Perhaps Your Majesty is just overly longing for that acquaintance... It might be best to wait until Sister Wan is well before making any plans.
(outwardly agreeing) What Ying'er says makes sense, (but in reality, he went to Lingering Fragrance Pavilion the next day to visit)
The Emperor visits Lingering Fragrance Pavilion more and more often now. With Consort Wan favored, the entire palace's beauties seem lackluster. Soon, His Majesty will forget me.
My lady, donâ€™t worry. His Majesty holds you dear in his heart and will surely not forget you.

That is not my greatest fear. I am worried that the affair of me replacing Consort Wan in Yimei Garden years ago might come to light. His Majesty would surely charge me with deceiving the emperor. Qiao'er, while nothing has happened yet, I will send you out of the palace. Find a good man to marry, and live a safe and peaceful life outside.
My lady, I do not wish to leave you. No matter what happens, I wish to stay by your side.

(a few days later) Lady Yu, His Majesty has learned about your affair of impersonating Consort Wan, but considering your years of patient service without other faults, His Majesty has decided to demote you to a palace maid.
I thank His Majesty.
Yu Ying'er's assumed identity was revealed, angering the Emperor, but in consideration of past sentiments, he demoted her to a palace maid, and she lived her life as an unfavored consort.

: (pauses to think) You meant well, how could I blame you? Alright, thereâ€™s no need to replace the imperial physician. Wish Wan Changzai good health. Yu, come with me to the Hall of Mental Cultivation.
: Yes, Your Majesty.
: (noticing the Emperor is lost in thought looking at her) Your Majesty, is there something on your mind? Iâ€™m willing to ease your worries.
: Itâ€™s nothing, I just remembered a woman from the past. Your gentleness reminds me a bit of her.
: (after a night has passed) I intend to promote you to Changzai, how do you feel about that?
: I am deeply grateful for Your Majestyâ€™s favor.
: You may go back now. I will summon you again tonight.
: (on the Fengluan chariot on the way to the Hall of Mental Cultivation) What is happening, why is there such a disturbance?
: Reporting to my lady, it was Xin Changzaiâ€™s maid who accidentally knocked over a lantern and bumped into you.

content.content: Someone must be scheming against me, find out who it is, no matter what it takes.
How could Xin Changzaiâ€™s maid knock over a lantern for no reason, something is fishy. Stop, I need to get out and see whatâ€™s going on.
Qiaoâ€™er, keep an eye on everyone here, no matter whose people they are, watch them closely and donâ€™t let any suspicious individuals get away.
Dare to block my path, seize everyone present, regardless of whom they belong to, and interrogate them harshly.

question: #question# How should Yu Yingâ€™er speak to demonstrate her information-processing ability in chaos?

content.content: : Forget it, we donâ€™t have the power to argue with others yet. Letâ€™s keep going, so we donâ€™t miss the timing.
: This is outrageous, Iâ€™m furious. (trying hard to suppress her anger) I want to get out and sort this out with them.
: Who are they? (thinking to herself, patience brings peace) Daring to crash into my carriage. Let me report this to the Emperor.
: This is too much (trying hard to control her anger) if I werenâ€™t in a hurry, I wouldnâ€™t let them get away with it.

question: #question# How should Yu Yingâ€™er speak to demonstrate her ability to manage negative emotions?

content.content: : Stop the carriage! I need to get out and see who dares to block my way.
: How dare you, are you blind, crashing into my chariot.
: Qiaoâ€™er, immediately call the Emperor here to judge on my behalf.

dialog.content: YÃ¼ Changzai, why are you acting so precious? It was just an accident, why make such a fuss?
How dare you not cooperate with me and speak so disrespectfully. Guards, take Xin's maidservant to the interrogation chamber for questioning.
Our ranks are the same, what gives you the right to detain my maid?

Because I'm favored by His Majesty. Even if he finds out, he'd stand up for me. Guards, slap her! If the servants dare to defy me, it's surely because the master instructed them to. Punish both of them and send them to the interrogation chamber.
How dare you!
Why wouldn't I dare! Guards, quickly arrest both of them.

Let me see who dares to misuse private punishment? Yu Changzai, you have the audacity to abuse power and punish others without first finding out the truth. All that gentleness and virtue you show, is it all an act?
Your Majesty, I realize my mistake now, I wouldn't dare do it again.
I will put an end to the misuse of power and bullying in the harem today. Guards, send Yu Changzai to the Cold Palace.
No, Your Majesty! How could you be so heartless? Have you forgotten all the joy and companionship we shared in the past?
Enough, take her away.
(After being sent to the Cold Palace) My whole life was wrong. Who deliberately set me up for this? I curse them to die a horrible death!

Filled with anger and resentment day after day, she eventually went insane, becoming a madwoman shunned by all. Everyone avoided her. In the end, the power drove Yu to lose her way, and her life ended in bitterness and despair.
: My lady, ever since Xin Changzai bullied you, everyone thinks you're easy to push around. They keep picking on us every few days. We should definitely retaliate.

: You must be cautious with every step. A little carelessness and you'll fall into someone else's trap. Only with the strongest evidence can you fight back. You've been with me for so long, yet you haven't made any progress?
: Yes, my lady, your teaching is right. My lady, the peach blossoms in the Imperial Garden are in full bloom. Shall we go out to enjoy the flowers?
: Sure, let's go.
: Your Highness, there is a man and woman in the woods ahead. Could they be... how audacious!!

: Shh, keep quiet. (Leans in to look closer) Thatâ€™s Wan Changzai and Prince Guo! How dare they carry on an affair in the palace? Qiao'er, quickly find Eunuch Su and tell His Majesty I'm waiting for him in the Imperial Garden.
: His Majesty has arrived.
: Long live His Majesty. Your Majesty, the peach blossoms are perfect today. I would like to invite you to enjoy the flowers in the peach grove.

: Yu Changzai, you are thoughtful. Who is ahead in the woods? Bold Wan Changzai! Prince Guo! You two are truly my good consort and good brother. How dare you conduct an affair here in broad daylight! Guards, banish Wan Changzai to the Cold Palace! Exile Prince Guo to Ningguta. I will ensure both of you shall never meet again in this lifetime!

: (Secretly delighted, thinking no one will ever discover the incident of replacing Zhen Huan in the Yimei Garden) Please calm down, Your Majesty. Allow me to accompany you back to the Hall of Mental Cultivation.

: Each and every one of my good concubines and ministers. All of you want to betray me! Nian Gengyao holds so much power in the northwest! He even harbors treasonous thoughts, and I'm about to execute him. His beloved sister, Consort Hua, has committed countless wrongs. No one in their Nian family should dream of surviving; execute them all.
: Your Majesty, please calm down. Ying'er will never betray you.
: My lady, I can't believe Consort Hua has fallen so quickly. Luckily, you didn't join her faction at the time, or the consequences would have been unimaginable.
: (Many years later) My lady, there are rumors swirling in the palace lately. A crazy concubine shouted loudly, saying something about the Empress killing the Empress, and was quickly taken away.
: (Opened up a chest of memories but is unwilling to recall) Times have changed. I'm no longer interested in these matters; I just want to live out the rest of my days in peace.
In this life, she stayed away from conflicts, resolving the crisis of her identity being exposed with forbearance and wit, living out her life in peace.
: My Lady, the Yikun Palace is really resplendent and beautiful, truly befitting Consort Hua's residence.
: Mind your tongue. Greetings to Consort Hua.
: (disdainfully) Rise. I've heard you still have a father back home. I can arrange for him to hold a position at court. But in return, you must serve me. Are you willing?
: This humble one has a low position and insignificant voice, unaware of how I could lighten Consort Hua's burdens.

: You're joking, sister. Everyone knows you're currently enjoying the emperor's favor, so you're very useful indeed. Didn't Her Majesty the Empress also extend an olive branch to you? Your choice to come to me shows you've already made your decision.

: Since I have received your favor, Consort Hua, I will certainly remain loyal to you. (Having joined Consort Hua's faction, she was compelled to commit many heinous deeds, helping Consort Hua eliminate one opponent after another, gradually becoming power-hungry and ruthless.)
: My Lady, there's terrible news. General Nian has been punished by the emperor, and Consort Hua's plea on his behalf has implicated her as well. I'm afraid the emperor will soon investigate us.
: Qiao'er, it seems we chose the wrong path back then. At this point, there's no way back for us. Qiao'er, whatever happens, promise me you won't leave me?
: My Lady, what are you saying? Qiao'er will never leave you.

Yu Ying'er was eventually implicated, with all her past deeds for Consort Hua exposed. The emperor was greatly disappointed in Yu Ying'er and eventually relegated her to the Cold Palace. Yu Ying'er and her only maidservant, Qiao'er, struggled through the latter part of their lives there.
: Yes, my lady.
: Qiao'er, quickly help me freshen up. Choose something in simple colors for my clothes, as the Empress does not like anything flashy.
: Sure, my lady. How about wearing something in green today? The Empress might like it.
: Greetings, Empress. I, Yu Ying'er, a humble consort, have come to pay my respects to the Empress.
: Sister, please rise.
: Thank you, Empress.
: Sister, your attire today is elegant and graceful, truly deserving of the Emperorâ€™s favor. I like it very much as well.
: The Empress praises me too much. When it comes to dignified grace, no woman can compare to the Empress.
: You do love to flatter. This is a red jade necklace that was tributed. I find its color youthful and lively. It might be too bright for me, but it suits a young lady like you perfectly.

content.content: The Empress is right. Thank you for the gift, Empress. Then I shall accept it.
Thank you, Empress for the gift. Is it really for me? I dare not accept such a valuable thing; I am not worthy.
The Empress is right. I trust the Empress completely, but surely you wouldnâ€™t use this necklace as a bribe for my life, would you?
Thank you, Empress for the gift. But I cannot accept it. It's too precious, yet I choose to trust the Empress.

question: #question# How should Yu Ying'er express her trust in others' opinions?

content.content: : The Empress overestimates me. This necklace is too valuable; I cannot accept it as I haven't earned it.
Thank you, Empress for the gift. I cannot accept it, my status is too low for such a fine necklace.
: Empress, you truly flatter me. How could I be worthy of such fine items? Please offer it to Lady Hua instead.
: Thank you, Empress for the gift, but I cannot accept it. I am not worthy of such a precious thing. Please bestow it on another consort.

question: #question# How can Yu Ying'er appropriately express her refusal to accept the Empress's gift?

dialog.content: As expected, this child has potential. I was not wrong about her.

(Several years later) My lady, something terrible has happened. The Empressâ€™s act of poisoning Consort Hua has been discovered by Consort Hua herself. Consort Hua is currently causing a disturbance in Jingren Palace, and His Majesty is on his way there. The Empress has summoned you to Jingren Palace.
I have a feeling something major is about to happen. Qiao'er, quickly help me change and let's head to the Empress's palace.
Your Majesty, it is my fault for not managing the harem well, which led to today's events.
Empress, it's not entirely your fault. If we go by your words, as Emperor, I also bear some responsibility.

Thank you, Your Majesty, for understanding my situation. A palace maid just reported that on the day Consort Hua was poisoned, Yu Changzai was seen sneaking around Yikun Palace. I beg Your Majesty to allow Eunuch Su to search Yu Changzai's quarters.
(Disheartened, realizing she has been used by the Empress) Your Majesty, Empress, Iâ€™m innocent!
If you are truly innocent, then I will send someone to search your quarters to prove your innocence.

Your Majesty, we've found a large amount of bitter almonds in Yu Changzai's quarters, and the poison Consort Hua suffered from matches that of bitter almonds. Judging by the quantity, it seems all the bitter almonds in the palace are here.

Yu, such audacity you have! I never imagined your intentions were so malicious. I see I have misjudged you. Guards, bring this venomous woman a cup of poison wine and let her taste what it feels like to die from poisoning.
No, Your Majesty! I am innocent, Your Majesty. It was the Empress who instructed me to do it. I am falsely accused.
How dare you! What nonsense are you spouting? How could I possibly instruct you to harm Consort Hua? I beseech Your Majesty for clarity.
There's evidence and witnesses; what more is there to argue? Guards, quickly bring the poison wine.
Yu Ying'er was forced to drink the poison wine, and was ultimately carried out of Jingren Palace. She chose the wrong path in life and became a casualty of palace intrigue.
(Suddenly changes expression) Yu Changzai, if you won't think about yourself, you should at least consider your family outside the palace. Don't you agree?
I'm sorry, Your Majesty. I still can't accept it.
(Sighs, resuming a kind demeanor) Different paths can't walk together. In that case, I won't force you anymore.
(Breathes a sigh of relief) Then I shall take my leave.
(A few peaceful days later) My lady, a letter from your family has arrived.
Quick, let me see it. Thankfully, the family is safe, it seems the Empress's threats were not carried out.
That's wonderful, my lady! Let's go to the lake and enjoy the lotus flowers.
Alright, let's go.
(Suddenly a dark figure appears) Qiao'er, Qiao'er, where did you go? Ah! (Gurgling noises)
Your Majesty, you must seek justice for my lady. She never had any thought of drowning herself in the lake. Someone must have pushed her! Please, Your Majesty and Empress, investigate thoroughly!
Where were you when your lady had her accident? Why weren't you by her side?
Replying to Your Majesty. On the way to the lotus pond, the Empress summoned me, saying she had important matters to instruct. That's why I left.

Yes, I did summon Qiao'er. I had no idea such a strange event would happen. Your Majesty, rest assured, you've entrusted the harem to me, and I will certainly give you and the late Yu Changzai an explanation.
Very well, as the head of the harem, you should set an example. I will leave this matter in your hands. I still have official duties and will return to the Hall of Mental Cultivation.
Respectfully seeing off Your Majesty. (Then reveals a satisfied expression)

Yu Ying'er was pushed into the lake and met a bizarre death. Ultimately, due to insufficient evidence, the Empress covered it up hastily. Yu Ying'er never knew that her murderer was her most trusted maid, Qiao'er.
